channel.title: SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Al Lemieux
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn Anytime, Anyplace
channel.itunes:summary: SyberWorks, Inc., a leader in the custom e-Learning solutions and Learning Management Systems industries presents an podcast series on useful and important topics in e-Learning, Learning Management Systems, custom online training development, instructional design, performance management, talent management, and human capital management.
channel.description: SyberWorks, Inc. Learn Anytime Any Place

item.title: #44 - A Fresh Look at Today's Accessibility Standards.
item.itunes:summary: A Fresh Look at Today's Accessibility Standards.

item.title: #43 - Developing Engaging Online Training with Live Web Cams and Augmented Reality
item.itunes:summary: Dave Powell, Documentation Manager at SyberWorks discusses the use of live web cams and augmented reality applications in e-learning development to help engage the learner.

item.title: #42 - Tips for Deploying Video in Training Content
item.itunes:summary: Al Lemieux, Senior Designer at SyberWorks discusses some tips for using video in e-learning courses from his recent article, Deploying Online Courses with Video Content.

item.title: #41 - The SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Compares Documentation and e-Learning, Same Mother - Different Fathers
item.itunes:summary: Dave Powell, Documentation Manager at SyberWorks discusses his recent articles Documentation and e-Learning Parts 1 and 2.

item.title: #40 - How an AICC Online Course Works with a Learning Management System (LMS)
item.itunes:summary: Stuart Campbell, Director of Software Engineering at SyberWorks discusses his latest article, 'AICC and the LMS.'

item.title: #39 - The Blurry Line between Learning Content Management Systems (LCMSs) and Learning Management Systems (LMSs)
item.itunes:summary: Bob Goldschneider, Director of Business Development at SyberWorks discusses his latest article, Need a Learning Content Management System?

item.title: #38 - SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Looks Back Over 2009 Episodes
item.itunes:summary: The 2009 holiday episode looks at the various topics covered on the SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Series.

item.title: #37 - Learning Management Systems Used in Distributor-Modeled Training
item.itunes:summary: Steve Pena, Senior Instructional Designer and Implementation Consultant at SyberWorks looks at learning management systems configuration and deployment in distributor-oriented organizations.

item.title: #36 - e-Learning Development Tools to Design Courses for the Net Generation Audience
item.itunes:summary: Steve Pena, Senior Instructional Designer and Implementation Consultant at SyberWorks discusses the e-learning development tools and techniques appropriate for designing online courses for 'Millennials' and the 'Net Generation' audience.

item.title: #35 - Shifts in Audience Demographics and its Impact on e-Learning Development
item.itunes:summary: Steve Pena, Senior Instructional Designer and Implementation Consultant at SyberWorks discusses the influence of audience demographic on e-learning development for the millennial generation.

item.title: #34 - Building Student Friendly Courses
item.itunes:summary: Dana Fine, Senior Instructional Designer and Implementation Consultant at SyberWorks provides guidelines for building student friendly courses.

item.title: #33 - Capturing e-Learning Audio
item.itunes:summary: Al Lemieux, Senior Designer at SyberWorks offers tips for recording e-learning audio.

item.title: #32 - Hidden Costs Associated with Hosted (SaaS) vs. Licensed LMS/LCMS Decisions
item.itunes:summary: Bob Goldschneider, Director of Business Development for SyberWorks discusses the Hidden Costs Associated with Hosted (Sass) vs. Licensed LMS/LCMS Decisions.

item.title: #31 - Using an LMS to Supplement On-The-Job Training Programs
item.itunes:summary: Using an LMS to Supplement On-The-Job Training Programs

item.title: #30 - SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast 30 Leadership Communication Strategies for a Multigenerational Workforce.
item.itunes:summary: Leadership Communication Strategies for a Multigenerational Workforce.

item.title: #29 - SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast 29 SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Discusses Learning Management System (LMS) Integration with Salesforce.com
item.itunes:summary: SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Discusses Learning Management System (LMS) Integration with Salesforce.com

item.title: #28 - SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast 28 Web Conference Training Tips
item.itunes:summary: SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Offers Web Conference Training Tips.

item.title: #27 - SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast 2008 Holiday Round Up
item.itunes:summary: This year's holiday episode looks at the year in review and the various topics covered on the SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Series.

item.title: #26 - SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Talks With Guy Wallace About His e-Book 'Management Areas of Performance.'
item.itunes:summary: Guy Wallace About His e-Book 'Management Areas of Performance.'

item.title: #25 - Steve Pena, Senior Instructional Designer and Implementation Consultant for SyberWorks discusses his article, '10 Instructional Design Tips for e-Learning Development.'
item.itunes:summary: 10 Instructional Design Tips for e-Learning Development

item.title: #24 - Dana Fine, Senior Instructional Designer for SyberWorks provides some guidelines for developing data exchange interfaces with a learning management system. The interview is based on her latest article, 'Designing Interfaces for Exchanging Data with a Learning Management System'.
item.itunes:summary: SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Discusses Data Exchange Interfaces Used with a Learning Management System

item.title: #23 - Stepheni Norton, Principal Consultant for 21 CFR Consulting LLC discusses FDA 21 CFR Part 11, in Regards to Compliance Training and Learning-Management-Systems Validation.
item.itunes:summary: Stepheni Norton, Principal Consultant for 21 CFR Consulting LLC discusses FDA 21 CFR Part 11, in Regards to Compliance Training and Learning-Management-Systems Validation.

item.title: #22 - Guy Wallace Talks about His e-Book, T and D Systems View.
item.itunes:summary: Guy Wallace, a Certified Performance Technologist and President of EPPIC, Inc. (an Instructional Design and Performance Improvement consulting firm in North Carolina)talks about his e-Book, T and D Systems View.

item.title: #21 - Tips for Using Flash in e-Learning Development.
item.itunes:summary: Al Lemieux, Senior Designer at SyberWorks, talks about his recent article on using Flash to develop e-Learning. He mentions the built-in SCORM and AICC compliant templates, output tips, and more.

item.title: #20 - Courses, Learning Events, Competencies, and Job Roles - Oh My!
item.itunes:summary: Dana Fine, Senior Instructional Designer and Implementation Consultant at SyberWorks, talks about the relationships and interactions between courses, learning events, competencies, and job roles in a learning management system (LMS).

item.title: #19 - Tips for Using Graphics in e-Learning
item.itunes:summary: Al Lemieux, Senior Designer at SyberWorks, talks about tips for using graphics in e-Learning, including important graphic factors like image size, content hierarchies, appropriate imagery, and more.

item.title: #18 - Tips for Creating Online Tests
item.itunes:summary: Dana Fine, Senior Instructional Designer for SyberWorks provides some great tips for creating online tests. The interview is based on her latest article, How to Guide for Creating Online Tests.

item.title: #17 - Is There Really a Workforce Shortage?
item.itunes:summary: Jim Kissane, a noted Workforce Development expert and fellow at RedVector, Inc. discusses the workforce shortage in today's employment marketplace.

item.title: #16 - 2007 Holiday Round-Up
item.itunes:summary: The holiday episode looks at the year in review and the various topics covered on the SyberWorks e-Learning Podcast Series.

item.title: #15 - Understanding the generations in today's workforce
item.itunes:summary: SyberWorks, Inc., a leader in custom e-Learning Solutions and the Learning Management System industry, today announces the next episode in their e-Learning Podcast Series: Understanding the generations in today's workforce.

item.title: #14 - Learn-ISD Part 2
item.itunes:summary: SyberWorks, Inc., a leader in custom e-Learning Solutions and the Learning Management System industry, today announces the next episode in their e-Learning Podcast Series: Lean-ISD, Part (2).

item.title: #13 - Learn-ISD Part 1
item.itunes:summary: SyberWorks, Inc., a leader in custom e-Learning Solutions and the Learning Management System industry, today announces the next episode in their e-Learning Podcast Series: Lean-ISD, Part (1).

item.title: #12 - Selecting The Proper Training Solution For Your Company's Needs
item.itunes:summary: Mark Bower, President and CEO of Bower and Company, Inc. (www.bowercompany.com), a learning and performance-management consulting firm located in Colorado discusses how to select the right training solutions for your organizations needs.

item.title: #11 - Hot Button Issues In Training Project Management
item.itunes:summary: Mark Bower, President and CEO of Bower and Company, Inc. (www.bowercompany.com), a learning and performance-management consulting firm located in Colorado talks about challenging issues in training project management and provides an answer to the question, How to turn down a project and not lose your job?

item.title: #10 - Using Business Language Instead of Training Speak
item.itunes:summary: Mark Bower, President and CEO of Bower and Company, Inc. (www.bowercompany.com), a learning and performance-management consulting firm located in Colorado discusses the value of using business language instead of learning professional language when working with the various organizational stakeholders that interact with your training department.

item.title: #9 - e-Learning Accessibility For Training Managers and Human Resource Professionals, Part 6
item.itunes:summary: Al Lemieux, Senior e-Learning Developer at SyberWorks discusses accessibility testing and some of the tools available on the Internet for use in this area.

item.title: #8 - e-Learning Accessibility For Training Managers and Human Resource Professionals, Part 5
item.itunes:summary: Al Lemieux, Senior e-Learning Developer at SyberWorks discusses how to develop accessible e-Learning using Flash and Flash accessibility.

item.title: #7 - e-Learning Accessibility For Training Managers and Human Resource Professionals, Part 4
item.itunes:summary: Al Lemieux, Senior e-Learning Developer at SyberWorks discusses W3C's Level three or Priority three Accessibility Checkpoint.

item.title: #6 - e-Learning Accessibility For Training Managers and Human Resource Professionals, Part 3
item.itunes:summary: Al Lemieux, Senior e-Learning Developer at SyberWorks discusses W3C's Level two or Priority two Accessibility Checkpoint.

item.title: #5 - e-Learning Accessibility For Training Managers and Human Resource Professionals, Part 2
item.itunes:summary: In the second part of a six part series, Al Lemieux, Senior e-Learning Developer at SyberWorks discusses W3C's Level one or Priority one Accessibility Checkpoints.

item.title: #4 - e-Learning Accessibility For Training Managers and Human Resource Professionals, Part 1
item.itunes:summary: Al Lemieux, Senior e-Learning Developer at SyberWorks covers some background on the Americans with Disabilities Act, Section 508, an introduction to the World Wide Web Consortium's Accessibility Guidelines.

item.title: #3 - Crafting Learning Activities and Simulations
item.itunes:summary: Interview with Dana Fine on developing learning activities and simulations for e-Learning content.

item.title: #2 - Creating Useful Online Surveys
item.itunes:summary: Interview with Dana Fine on tips for writing an effective online survey.

item.title: #1 - e-Learning Content Tool Selection
item.itunes:summary: Interview with Dana Fine on choosing the right content authoring tool for your e-Learning needs.
item.itunes:keywords: LMS, Learning Management Systems, e-Learning, online training, online training development, instructional design, performance management, talent management, human capital management
